title: Orcfax: trustworthy Cardano oracles
description: スマートコントラクトの開発者は、信頼できる現実世界の事実を必要としていますが、本物の情報を提供するCardanoのオラクルはありません。

f6_assessments.q0: This type of project is obviously imperative for functioning smart contracts and we need to fund this type of research.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has a clear plan to develop a specification and has experience in data archiving. I find it a little troubling that no reference has been made to work on oracle pools done by Emurgo and implemented on the ERGO blockchain (https://github.com/Emurgo/Emurgo-Research/blob/master/oracles/Oracle-Pools.md). It is imperative any research in this space is in collaboration with the other Cardano entities like Emurgo and IOG who are researching in this area.
f6_assessments.q2: A well defined plan with deliverables. Success obviously needs to make sure it is measuring acceptance of the specification as an industry standard. This means successful deployment in functioning smart contracts, not just ISO and IEEE registration.

f6_assessments.q0:
Mr. Van Garderen seems to understand the importance of being able to meet industry standards in order to establish a trustworthy and verifiable oracle for information. This is also important as this could expand adoption beyond the current crypto community and users to non blockchain based businesses and institutions.

He has references into the NIST and ISO standards as well as the Zero-Trust model as guideline towards the end state that he wants to achieve. These are the standard for non-blockchain based businesses and institutions.
f6_assessments.q1:
Mr. Van Garderen has prior experience as a developer, gives me reason to believe the likelihood of success is very high.

Reference: https://vangarderen.net/

He has references to the NIST and ISO standards as well as the Zero-Trust model as guideline towards the end state that he wants to achieve. The standards and models referenced align with "AAA" in Network Security which are "Authentication, Authorization and Accounting". 

Authentication: Proving the asset or person is what it say it it.

Authorization: Granting access once authenticated based on rights or privileges granted by System or Network owner.

Accounting: Monitoring and recording all actions performed while accessing the system or network.

This aligns directly with the goals he wishes to achieve. This isn't a crazy idea. It is already in existence in legacy networks and systems. He is simply bringing it to blockchain as an Oracle.


(My Relevant Experience: I am a Network Security Engineer who has deployed security solutions in both the private and public sector)
f6_assessments.q2:
On his website he has a roadmap on how to achieve the end goal. 

Based on this, I have reason to believe the odds of achieving this are high.

Reference: https://orcfax.link/#about

The multiple references provided for the standards that must be met indicates that this is well researched.

His requests for funds match the total projected cost expenditures listed in his proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Oracles will provide the ground truth for almost all smart contracts to which need inputs from the real world. There is a requirement for reliable and redundant oracles which can be trusted based on distributed trust. Therefore there is a need for a command standard and software which follows that for the establishing oracles. There have been few proposals in the earlier funds for oracles. However, there is a need for more than one oracle source and standards for ensuring federation and trust. This proposal serves this important function.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has more than 15 papers published in the related field and is proposing hiring senior engineers to design and implement the proposal. The model follows the core principles of Cardano and is sound. The proposer also has more than 15 years of experience; therefore, the project s likely to be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The tasks involved in the implementation have been given out clearly, and a realistic time plan has been given in the proposal. An estimate of the cost is also provided.  The justification of 75$ per hour is provided. There are clear checkpoints to monitor the progress and the measure the success of the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
Overall, this is a very mature proposal, well written and easy to follow even though its complexity. First, the proposer identified a pain point of many devs in our system, that there is no standard in data ingestion to authenticate and authorize assets or persons. 
This well-needed solution could have a great impact on our ecosystem in general and in addition will support developers in creating related applications more easily. This could definitely accelerate adoption of Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The presented plan has all details that you want to see on such a complex project. Also the team behind this initiative is very experienced and has already proven their ability to deliver such a software. the outlined plan, the experience of the team make a successful implementation very likely. Budgeting and tasks are linked together. From my perspective this budget compared to the impact of the proposal is very reasonable. Of course it is always possible to provide more technical information, however the outlined plan, the experience of the team make a successful implementation very likely.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer presented a clear roadmap, a clear timeline and a clear deliverable.
There is a already a repository linked, which is not filled yet, but it gives the community the possibility to track the progress of this project. The only thing that probably could be improved is to reflect more about the challenge that might occur in trying to get market acceptance for this project. Overall, this is a very well thought-out project that is ready to be implemented. Auditability is very well possible for the community

experience: 世界で最も広く導入されている信頼できるデジタルアーカイブシステムの開発に20年の経験を持つプロのアーキビストが率いるチーム。
